title.narrative: Strategic advice and design capacity to support the programme design for Water as Leverage Cartagena

description.narrative: Building on the successful Water as Leverage for Resilient Cities Asia programme – which focused on the cities of Chennai (India), Khulna (Bangladesh), and Semarang (Indonesia) – and the lessons generated through them, the Water as Leverage approach and processes target the need for integral, inclusive and innovative projects from the earliest stages of project preparation to unlock the complex challenges that hamper climate-resilient urban water projects. As part of the delta cooperation between Colombia and the Netherlands, it is the ambition to investigate the possibility for a Water as Leverage Cartagena programme, to be executed through Partners for Water.WaL provides Cartagena with a roadmap for development: it is focused on the design of future projects that are innovative, bankable, and scalable and puts the pre-project preparation stage at its centre. This stage is the starting point of the project development process (see image below), but often lacks investments and capacity. Proper investment in this pre-project preparation stage should lead to the creation of project proposals that can accurately address the complexity of Cartagena, integrating all stakeholders as part of an inclusive process. Through WaL the Netherlands aims to be the facilitator of a process and act as a broker in connecting the very much needed integral/holistic project development process with potential sources of implementation finance.This assignment aims to strengthen the preparatory process for WaL Cartagena by integrating research and design thinking and communicative capacities into the programme design and initiation phase.
